apiKey.name: x-api-key
apiKey.description: An API key is required to access the API.

get.summary: Welcome to the Sort API! ðŸ‘‹
get.description:
# Welcome

This API allows you to query [Sort](https://sort.xyz) databases, create Change Requests, manage your account, and much more.

## Getting started

### 1. Get your API key ðŸ”‘

First, visit [our docs page](https://docs.sort.xyz/docs/api-keys) to learn how to obtain your API key. Once you have your API key, move on to the next step.

### 2. Execute an HTTP request ðŸ”„

When issuing HTTP requests, you'll always set the `x-api-key` request header to your API key.  For example, if using `curl` this looks like:

```bash
curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.sort.xyz/v2/my/profile \
  --header 'x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY' \
  --header 'accept: application/json' \
```

Run the above command to receive your first response from the Sort API.

Note: If you are reading this on [https://docs.sort.xyz](https://docs.sort.xyz/),
you'll set this API key above the example code section where it says `Header`.
After that you'll be able to run the code examples.

### 3. Congratulations ðŸ¥³

Congratulations! You've successfully run your first HTTP request using the [Sort](https://sort.xyz) API.
Next, check out the rest of our [API documentation](https://docs.sort.xyz/reference) to see how you can integrate your project. ðŸ˜Ž

## Useful links

- [Sort.xyz](https://sort.xyz)
- Documentation
  - [API Docs](https://docs.sort.xyz/reference)
  - [Guides](https://docs.sort.xyz)
  - [OpenApi Spec](https://api.sort.xyz/docs/json)
- Social
  - [Blog](https://blog.sort.xyz/)
  - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sort_xyz)
  - [Github](https://github.com/sortxyz)

get.summary: Get your Sort Profile
get.description: Gets your Sort Profile.

delete.description: Deletes your Sort Profile and all associated data.

get.summary: List your API keys
get.description: Lists all API keys for the authenticated user.

summary.description: A summarization of how this API key is being used

post.description:
Creates an API key the authenticated user.

Make sure to save the returned API key as you will not be able to see it again.
To manage existing API keys, you'll reference the key's `id`.

get.summary: Get your Sort Organizations
get.description: Gets the Sort Organizations to which you belong.

post.description: Creates a Sort Organization and makes you an owner.

get.summary: Get a Sort Organization
get.description: Gets the Sort Organization with the given slug.

patch.description: Updates a Sort Organization you own.

delete.description: Removes a Sort Organization you own.

get.summary: Get all database connections of an Organization
get.description:
Gets the database connections of an Organization.

Note: The response includes connection metadata only. It does not include the
connection strings.

get.summary: Get a database Connection
get.description:
Gets a database Connection.

Note: The response includes connection metadata only. It does not include the
connection string.

post.summary: Import a snapshot of a Connection's schemas
post.description:
Imports a snapshot of a Connection's schemas.

[Documentation](https://docs.sort.xyz/docs/re-importing-your-database-schemas)

get.summary: Get the databases of a Sort Organization
get.description: Gets all databases for all Connections of a Sort Organization.

get.summary: Get a database
get.description: Gets an imported database by name.

get.summary: Get all database Change Requests
get.description: Gets all Change Requests for a database.

get.summary: Get a Change Request
get.description: Gets a Change Request.

get.summary: Get the Changes of a Change Request
get.description: Gets the Changes of a Change Request.

post.description: Creates a Change for a Change Request.

patch.description: Updates a single Change of a Change Request.

delete.description: Deletes a Change from a Change Request.

patch.description: Begins execution of a Change Request. This operation is asynchronous.

get.summary: Get all Relations for a Change Request
get.description: Get all Relations for a Change Request.

post.description: Creates a Relation between an Issue and a Change Request.

issue_number.description: The number of the Issue to relate to the Change Request

delete.description: Deletes a Relation between an Issue and a Change Request.

get.summary: Get the active Reviews of a Change Request
get.description:
Gets all active Change Request Reviews for the given `change_request_number`.

Only the latest Review submitted by a reviewer is considered active. A reviewer
has only one active Review at a time.

get.summary: Get a Change Request Review
get.description: Gets a Change Request Review.

patch.summary: Update a Change Request Review comment
patch.description: Updates a Change Request Review comment.

get.summary: Get a subset of Change Request event history
get.description: Gets a subset of Change Request event history.

get.summary: Get the Connection of a database
get.description: Gets the Connection of a database.

get.summary: Get all Database Issues
get.description: Gets all Database Issues.

get.summary: Get an Issue
get.description: Gets an Issue.

get.summary: Gets all Relations for an Issue
get.description: Gets all Relations for an Issue.

get.summary: Get a subset of Issue event history
get.description: Gets a subset of Issue event history.

get.summary: Get all Labels for the given database
get.description: Gets all Labels for the given database.

post.summary: Create a Label for a database
post.description: Creates a Label for a database.

get.summary: Get Label
get.description: Gets a Label.

get.summary: Get the database schemas, optionally including tables and columns
get.description:
Gets the database schemas, optionally including tables and columns.

To include tables, pass the querystring parameter `include=tables`.
To include tables and columns, pass the querystring parameter `include=columns`.

get.summary: Get all tables of a database schema, optionally including columns
get.description:
Gets the tables of a database schema, optionally including columns.

To include columns, pass the querystring parameter `include=columns`.

get.summary: Get all columns of a table
get.description: Gets the columns of a database table.

get.summary: Search for Change Requests
get.description: Search for Change Requests.

get.summary: Search for Issues
get.description: Searches for Issues.

get.summary: Get all member invites for a Sort Organization
get.description: Gets all member invites for the specified Organization.

get.summary: Get a Sort Organization Invite
get.description: Gets a Sort Organization Invite by id.

get.summary: Get the members of a Sort Organization
get.description: Gets the members of a Sort Organization.

patch.summary: Update a member of a Sort Organization
patch.description: Updates a member of a Sort Organization.

delete.summary: Remove a member from a Sort Organization
delete.description: Removes a member from a Sort Organization.

get.description: Gets all Queries of an Organization.

get.description: Gets a Query.

get.description: Search for Organizations, Databases, and Tables based on the provided querystring.
